{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3153137,"name":"Dora Saylƒ±koƒülu","username":"kyamet456","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kyamet456/{size}/182828_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-26T16:46:07.180Z","cooked":"

I‚Äôve been tryna automate subsystems and commands with single click buttons on my joystick. When I try to use JoystickButton methods it only shows whileTrue and whileFalse. When I try to use methods like whenPressed, to be able to not press down a button, it shows that they‚Äôre deprecated.
Would there be any errors due to using deprecated methods, if so, how can I achieve the practicality that I said a couple of sentences ago (to just push for a moment and not hold down)?

image894√ó332 30.5 KB

The non deprecated version for this year is the CommandXboxController. You won‚Äôt run into any problems using the deprecated class, but it will stop working either next year or the year after.

You‚Äôd be looking for onTrue()

github.wpilib.org

Trigger (WPILib API 2023.4.2)

declaration: package: edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.button, class: Trigger

I‚Äôd also recommend reading over the ‚ÄúNew for x year‚Äù page on the WPILib Docs Site, as it covers everything new, as well as changed year to year.

FIRST Robotics Competition Documentation

New for 2023

A number of improvements have been made to FRC ¬Æ Control System software for 2023. This article will describe and provide a brief overview of the new changes and features as well as a more complete...

Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3153255,"name":null,"username":"Starlight220","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/starlight220/{size}/150872_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-26T21:05:39.684Z","cooked":"

I‚Äôll clear some stuff up. I recommend reading through this article: Binding Commands to Triggers ‚Äî FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

There are two parts of trigger binding: getting the trigger instance, and binding the command to it. Both of them have new variants for 2023, but the status of the old is different.

Getting the trigger instance

  • OLD: Creating a JoystickButton instance with a regular HID object such as XboxController.
  • NEW: named factory methods on the command HID classes such as CommandXboxController.

Both of these approaches are here to stay!
(as a side note, I think most people would prefer the syntax of the latter approach, but that‚Äôs up to personal preference)

Binding commands

  • OLD: Two parallel method sets for Trigger (terms based on Active) and Button (terms based on Pressed), with when/while/toggle.

  • NEW: A single set of methods for Trigger (terms based on True/False), with on/while/toggle.

Unlike the above, here only the new approach will remain. ALL the old methods are deprecated and will be removed in 2024!
Deprecation messages on all the old methods should clearly point from the old methods to their replacements.

The docs page I linked at the top explains all of this with code examples; I recommend reading it through.
For those who don‚Äôt want to scroll back up, here‚Äôs the link again: Binding Commands to Triggers ‚Äî FIRST Robotics Competition documentation
